questiontext.text:
Exercise

Find the area bounded by the curve \(y = {@exp3@}\) and the t-axis between \(t = {@l3@}\) and \(t = {@u3@}\). [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

You should check that the required area lies entirely above the horizontal axis.

generalfeedback.text:
Since the required area lies entirely above the horizontal axis for each question, the area under the curve \(y\) between \(t = a\) and \(t = b\) is \(\displaystyle\int_{a}^{b} y(t) \, \mathrm{d}t\).

\(\displaystyle \int_{@l3@}^{@u3@} {@exp3@} \, \mathrm{d}t = \left[ {@int(exp3,t)@} \right]_{@l3@}^{@u3@} = {@ta3@}.\)
